body.name: USX MOUNT UL Listed Full Motion TV Mount, Swivel Articulating Tilt TV Wall Mount for 26-55Inch LED, 4K TVs, Wall Mount TV Bracket with VESA 400x400mm Up to 77lbs, Perfect Center Design -XMM006-1
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 2 hrs 24 mins
features: TV WALL MOUNT COMPATIBLITY: This full motion TV mount fits for most of 26-55inch TVs with VESA size 75*75mm to 400*400mm available and perfect center design.

ADJUSTABLE VIEW COMFORTABLE: This swivel TV mounting bracket with articulating arms includes +5° /-15° tilt, ±90°swivel( maximum TV swivel angle depends on your TV), +/-5° post-installation adjustment allows the perfect TV leveling.The TV wall mount of USX MOUNT will make your TV flexibility and better view based on your seat in the room. The TV wall holder also let your TV mounted in the corner.

EASY TO INSTALL: Detailed instruction and all included hardware in pre-labeled bags. This TV mount is designed for use in wood stud, solid concrete walls - DO NOT install into drywall alone Warm tips: In order to avoid customer misusing concrete anchors onto wood studs or drywall directly causing any safety issues, we removed concrete anchors from our package. If you need concrete anchors, please contact us to get it for free which be sent from USA.

SAVING SPACE & HEAVY DUTY: This TV wall mount tilt can pull out to 18.95” and retract back to 2.81”, which save some valuable space for you and make your house look neat. The wall mount TV bracket unit is made of heavy duty steel by lots of advanced automatic machines.

PRODUCT INCLUDES: Come with bubble level, 3 pieces pack of cable ties and all standard mounting hardware(►TV Screws: M4*12mm 4pcs, M4*30mm 4pcs, M6*12mm 4pcs, M6*35mm 4pcs, M8*25mm, M8*45mm. ►Spacers: M6*17mm 4pcs, M8*22mm 4pcs, 10mm 4pcs, 2.5mm 8pcs. ►Washers: M4 4pcs, M6 4pcs.), 10-year friendly US-based customer service.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bad Reviews Are Sour Grapes
reviews.reviewText: In my opinion this is a good quality product worth buying that does everything it says it will. I used it to mount a 43 inch Vizio T.V. in our bedroom.After reading some of the bad reviews I had some reservations about purchasing this particular bracket but once I received it I found it to be exactly as described. I had no issues, what-so-ever, with the install. To me the bad reviews seem like either sour grapes or the competition is just trying to sabotage their competitors with falsely written bad reviews.Addressing some of the issues mentioned in those bad reviews:This is a full motion mount. It will tilt left or right slightly but that actual alignment is supposed to be handled when installing the bracket. That is why they provide a level. Still it can be adjusted slightly after install.Secondly, people who do not own any tools should not be trying to install mechanical devices on their own and then complain about. It's not hard to install but you do need to have the most basic of mechanical skills and some tools.Thirdly, There are no T.V. mounts that are designed to be installed directly into a drywall wall surface. For safety reasons they always require being mounted to one of the 2X4 wall studs unless, of course this is being mounted to a brick wall.If you don't know how to locate a wall stud for mounting then you should probably hire someone to mount this for you.Finally the tilt, swing and swivel adjustments do need some tweaking in my opinion so they move more easily and have better freedom of movement. They do come snugged down a little too tightly from the factory in my opinion. These are all completely adjustable with the right Allen wrench and at minimum a pair of pliers or a small crescent wrench. Open ended or box wrenches would be better. A socket wrench is best.With all that said finding a wall stud is the hardest part of the install. Once a 2x4 wall stud is located the rest goes pretty smoothly. I had no problems with any of the hardware. If you are stripping out screws or snapping off the head of screws or bolts then you either have the wrong size screw, the wrong thread pattern on the screw or you have cross threading the screw when you installed it. Don't do that!Also these screws do not require 40 foot pounds of torque so, very simply, do not over tighten them.Any screw head will snap off if you continue to over torque it once it is tight, or if you have it cross threaded and try to force it into the hole. If you find yourself having to force a bolt or screw, Stop! something is wrong so back it out and try again. I found nothing wrong with the hardware provided. These are not junk screws that are not too soft for the job they are designed to do. I did not find any that were too soft, misthreaded or with bad heads.Over all these is a great bracket with nice features, quality construction and it is very secure.I had plenty of range of tilt and it does hold the TV securely in whatever position I set it for.You will need a drill and drill bit, some basic wrenches, basic screwdrivers and Allen wrenches and at the very least a crescent wrench for adjusting the tension on all the pivot points. Box wrenches would be better. Sockets would be best.So to all those people who felt compelled to write bad reviews, if you don't own a tool box that is not the manufacturers fault. If you don't have any of the most basic of mechanical skills that are needed that also is not the manufacturers fault. And if you choose not to follow the instructions, or try to take shortcuts, that absolutely is not the manufacturers fault. That's a you thing.Quit writing bad reviews because of your own lack of ability, lack of understanding or your lack of willingness to follow the instructions.. I am so tired of the 3 or 4 percent of people who seem that they are never happy with anything or feel compelled to fill their days by writing bad reviews on the internet. SOURGRAPES! Grow up.I can assure you that this is a quality product and I personally had no problems installing it. It took me about 2 hours to complete the install including readjusting all the pivot points to my liking.I would buy these item again if i needed it and I would refer this item to a friend. You can buy this item with confidence. It's a good wall mount.Once last thing to all you sour grapes people just so you know. I do not work for the manufacturer or Amazon, nor have I been paid or compensated in any way to write a favorable review. I am a 65 year old retiree living in Northern Michigan. I just felt compelled to clear a few things up for those people who are looking to purchase an item like this. Especially after reading the bad reviews and the reason those people gave for writing those bad reviews.Sour grapes!!!SincerelyKelly

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This mount was much easier to install than I thought it would be. I had the mount and TV installed in about an hour. It has great range of motion and the tilt / level adjustments are easy and seem very secure, no slippage after setting. Hard to beat this mount for the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very easy to install. Mounted to my 47” LG with 400x400 pattern with no wobble. Tilt and full adjustability make this ideal for placement where studs aren’t centered. Great price, would buy again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great range of motion and easy to install.
reviews.reviewText: The wife and I are getting older and the small TV we had in the closet on a dresser was too small for us to read the guide and any lettering on screen. There was. NO PLACE to put a larger TV in the room the layout where we could both see it from the bed- except between out two closets. I had purchased a 43" TV at Christmas so I needed a mount that could fit in the limited space and still move out far enough to open the closet doors. This mount proved to be perfect! Most of the time we can open the doors enough to not even have to move the TV to either side, but if needed it can swing completely out of the way. I did have to cut a small board to fit in-between the closet doors so the screws would go into the framing wood, but that was a simple fix. and the mount base hides it anyway. The mount is sturdy and moves easily. It comes with multiple mounting options and the hardware needed. Very pleased!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars fabulous quality, range of motion is top notch, great value, and a BITCH to put together!
reviews.reviewText: We love everything about this TV mount, but as my husband says, if he didn’t promise he’d have it put together in 4 hours, he would have sent it back just looking at the bag of parts. All I can say is it looks great in our bedroom (because it disappears) it works beautifully (I couldn’t find a position it couldn’t hold) and we were astounded at the overall quality (given what we paid) but I didn’t have to assemble it. Apparently it’s a challenge, even for the gifted & talented!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Plenty of strength to secure and swing a Samsung 43" TV into a perfect viewing position.
reviews.reviewText: You will need at least minimal DIY skills to properly hang this mount.Positive location of the middle of a 2x4 stud is paramount for a successful and safe mounting. This, and all other instructions must be adhered to. Read them carefully BEFORE beginning.The above statements would hold true for any product for mounting a TV on a wall.That said, the job is not difficult, and very satisfying in the end.An electronic stud finder will be a big help in locating a stud, and specifically, the CENTER of the stud, as the mounting holes NEED TO BE STRAIGHT, AND IN THE CENTER OF THE STUD. They also need to be drilled to a specified depth. To accomplish that, position the drill in the chuck, using a ruler to measure the amount of drill that sticks out, then tighten the chuck. Drill the hole until the chuck just touches the wall.Only three holes are required to be drilled. The rest of the process is just putting things together and insuring all screws and bolts are correctly installed and tightened sufficiently ... but not overtightened. Attaching the TV to the mount is a breeze, and leveling it is simple, as well. Once finished, you will be able to swing your TV into the perfect viewing position, and stow it nearly flat against the wall when not in use.
